description:
What is the India Heritage Experience all about?

As you would probably agree, Heritage is not about facts, dates, chronology and personalities.  Heritage is about real life stories - only they happened in the past, in very different times.  They teach us quite a bit about various aspects of life - art, culture, religions, philosophy, technology, architecture, lifestyle, science, politics and strategy. 

This course is about bringing forth some of these aspects of heritage to the forefront, and eliciting introspection.  The style used is immersive and asks the viewer to engage and participate and develop opinions. 

The course is focused on one of the most intriguing countries with a heritage as rich as can be.  INDIA. 

The course adopts a unique approach of contextualizing history around world heritage sites, ancient ruins and heritage districts, enabling the learner to frame the concepts around actual remnants from the past.  Rare photographs have been captured by celebrated photographers.  Archival images have been dug out and presented in the narrative.  You will be mesmerized.    

The format of course delivery is a documentary screening.  Narrators are historical characters and not professors.

What heritage sites are covered?

  1. Taj Mahal
  2. Agra Fort
  3. Qutb Minar
  4. Red Fort
  5. Humayun's Tomb
  6. Golconda Fort
  7. Gateway of India - Fort Heritage District of Mumbai

What kind of materials is included?

Videos.

We also have interesting Crossword puzzles for you to solve after every lesson.  These are great to summarize key highlights. 

How long will the course take to complete?

The Ancient History of India course will take about 10 hours to complete.  About 6 hours video lesson time.  About 4 hours to solve Crossword puzzles.

How is the Ancient History of India course structured?

We have chosen to structure the course monument-wise.  This provides you a very strong context for all information so you can logically store them in your memory.  It will also help reinforce all information should you travel to any of these locations anytime soon. 

Why take this course?

  • You love art, photography, history, heritage or stories.
  • You are curious about India and what was it about its past that made it so special and an object of desire
  • You are connected to India, but don't know much about it, and would like to spruce up your knowledge
  • Award-winning experts have developed the course after months of research and hard work - so you know you're receiving absolutely top quality and authentic experience.
title: The India Heritage Experience
